 @return The assigned Vega Asset Id for given ERC20 token

attributes.text:
@param asset_source Contract address for given ERC20 token
 @return The assigned Vega Asset Id for given ERC20 token

@param vega_asset_id Vega-assigned asset ID for which you want the ERC20 token address
 @return The ERC20 token contract address for a given Vega Asset Id

deposit_asset(address,uint256,bytes32).details: MUST emit Asset_Deposited if successfulERC20 approve function should be run before running this

params.amount: Amount of tokens to be deposited into Vega
params.asset_source: Contract address for given ERC20 token
params.vega_public_key: Target vega public key to be credited with this deposit

params.vega_asset_id: Vega-assigned asset ID for which you want the ERC20 token address

returns._0: The ERC20 token contract address for a given Vega Asset Id

params.asset_source: Contract address for given ERC20 token

returns._0: Maximum valid deposit of given ERC20 token

params.asset_source: Contract address for given ERC20 token

returns._0: Minimum valid deposit of given ERC20 token

params.asset_source: Contract address for given ERC20 token

returns._0: The assigned Vega Asset Id for given ERC20 token

params.asset_source: Contract address for given ERC20 token
Contract address for given ERC20 token
params.nonce: Vega-assigned single-use number that provides replay attack protection
params.signatures: Vega-supplied signature bundle of a validator-signed order
params.vega_asset_id: Vega-generated asset ID for internal use in Vega Core

params.asset_source: Contract address for given ERC20 token
params.nonce: Vega-assigned single-use number that provides replay attack protection
params.signatures: Vega-supplied signature bundle of a validator-signed order

params.asset_source: Contract address for given ERC20 token
params.nonce: Vega-assigned single-use number that provides replay attack protection
params.signatures: Vega-supplied signature bundle of a validator-signed order

params.amount: Amount of ERC20 tokens to withdraw
params.asset_source: Contract address for given ERC20 token
params.expiry: Vega-assigned timestamp of withdrawal order expiration
params.nonce: Vega-assigned single-use number that provides replay attack protection
params.signatures: Vega-supplied signature bundle of a validator-signed order
params.target: Target Ethereum address to receive withdrawn ERC20 tokens

deposit_asset(address,uint256,bytes32).notice: This function allows a user to deposit given ERC20 tokens into VegaERC20 approve function should be run before running this

get_deposit_maximum(address).notice: This view returns maximum valid deposit

get_deposit_minimum(address).notice: This view returns minimum valid deposit

is_asset_listed(address).notice: This view returns true if the given ERC20 token contract has been listed valid for deposit

list_asset(address,bytes32,uint256,bytes.notice: This function lists the given ERC20 token contract as valid for deposit to this bridgeSee MultisigControl for more about signatures

remove_asset(address,uint256,bytes).notice: This function removes from listing the given ERC20 token contract. This marks the token as valid for deposit to this bridgeSee MultisigControl for more about signatures

set_deposit_maximum(address,uint256,uint.notice: This function sets the maximum allowable deposit for the given ERC20 tokenSee MultisigControl for more about signatures

set_deposit_minimum(address,uint256,uint.notice: This function sets the minimum allowable deposit for the given ERC20 tokenSee MultisigControl for more about signatures

withdraw_asset(address,uint256,uint256,a.notice: This function sets the maximum allowable deposit for the given ERC20 tokenSee MultisigControl for more about signatures

userdoc.notice: Implementations of this interface are used by Vega network users to deposit and withdraw ERC20 tokens to/from Vega.
